basics.name: Lazuardi Al-Muzaki
basics.label: Data Analyst and Scientist
basics.summary: An aspiring educator with specialization in quantitative approaches. Passionate in the utilization of data in solving real-world, business and industrial problems.

work.name: Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember, Department of Business Management
Inalyst Indonesia of Telkom Indonesia
work.summary: Designed and curated problem-solving, quantitative-based solution proposals to enterprise-level clients. Acted as company's spokesperson during enterprise-level project meetings, facilitating communication between clients and the team providing Data as a Service (DaaS).
highlights: Led a team of Data Scientists, Software Developers, and a UI/UX Designer as the Product/Project Manager to develop a digital infrastructure for employee competency assessment in Data Science and Machine Learning. Collaborated with a third-party company to design machine learning case studies, including Classification, Clustering, Recommender Systems, and Deep Learning.

work.name: Turangga Resources of Astra International
work.position: Operational Monitoring and Cost Control Analyst
work.summary: Extracted, processed, analyzed, and reported operational activity data while developing data processing infrastructure and a data center for documentation and analysis. Calculated and reviewed operational costs, identifying cost reduction opportunities. Conducted operational research and process improvement, presenting insights to stakeholders for decision-making.
highlights: Initiated and managed a project to enhance standard operating procedures, improve the monitoring system, and propose contract adjustments between the company and a contractor, resulting in annual cost savings of approximately £300,000 (Rp. 6,000,000,000).
Conducted a study to design coal operation activity budgeting using motion time study and inferential statistics as part of a graduate program project.

work.name: Inalyst Indonesia of Telkom Indonesia
work.summary: Formulated method-based problem-solving solutions for individual clients through consultations and software, including dashboards and models. Led the company's platform development in the Data as a Service (DaaS) marketplace, overseeing product design, management, and customer service for clients and analysts.
highlights: Discrete-Event Modelling of Port Management System in Tanjung Perak, Surabaya
HR Analytics for Employee Training Recommendation.

work.name: Municipal Planning and Development Office of Surabaya City
work.summary: Led a team of six in conducting a Maintenance and Cost Study for Surabaya City’s House Pump. Responsibilities included primary data gathering, survey design, data processing, and applying statistical methods. The project resulted in recommendations for a maintenance schedule, failure prediction insights, and maintenance cost analysis.

work.name: Ministry of Communication and Information Technology of Surabaya Region
work.summary: Conducted a project of Model Building for Inflation Prediction and Policy Analysis of Consumer Price Index as associate responsible as main modeler representing the undergraduate department institute. Applied simulation technique, specifically system dynamics.

volunteer.summary: Provide and assist potential student embarking higher education and scholarship opportunity. Additionally covering mentoring topics about Business Analytics, Industrial Engineering, Quantitative Modelling and many more.

Coordinated academic support for the Indonesian student community by fostering mentor connections and providing academic consultations. Designed and executed events to help students prepare dissertations and publish in journals.

volunteer.organization: Quantitative Modelling and Industrial Policy Analysis Research Laboratory
volunteer.summary: Led a team of assistants to develop and execute the university laboratory's work program. Provided academic assistance and conducted teaching activities related to the laboratory. Participated in internal upgrades, tutorials, software training, and project collaborations. Served as a tutor for public workshops promoting laboratory tools in modeling and optimization for industrial case studies.

awards.title: International Industrial Simulation Competition
awards.summary: A competition that requires to solve an industrial case study presented in a paper journal. During the final round, engage in a simulation game involving industrial production, procurement, and sales activities. This simulation includes a demonstration of competencies in Production Planning and Market Strategy.'

publications.name: Evaluasi Kegiatan Pengiriman dan Penerimaan Kontainer Dalam Usaha Meminimalkan Waktu Singgah Truk Di Terminal Teluk Lamong
publications.summary: Application of discrete event simulation for resource planning and entity scheduling to minimize truck turnaround times at a green port in Surabaya.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
